main event: A civilian observer in Osborn, Ohio reported a single unidentified aerial object on June 29, 1949, which appeared to be larger than an F-80 aircraft and made a SW to NE course for 3-4 seconds before disappearing into the clouds.
interesting points: The object was estimated to be larger than an F-80 aircraft and appeared to be made of aluminum, resembling a conventional aircraft.
The observer, a radio engineer and USAF member, was considered to be reliable.
There were no photographs or physical evidence of the sighting.
The observer estimated the object's speed at 1200 miles per second and noted that there was no sound or odor associated with it.
The report also mentions an F-80 jet aircraft landing at 1446, but no known Flight Test Division aircraft airborne in the vicinity at the time of the reported sighting.
witnesses: civilian observer, radio engineer, USAF member
